SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 23rd AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
Fighting is taking place on practically the whole front from LIHONS, south of the SOMME, to the COJEUL RIVER. Our troops are reported to be making progress at a number of points and to have repulsed enemy counter-attacks.
French Front.
From ROYE to the AISNE there is no material change in the situation but fighting is continuing along the DIVETTE RIVER which the French have crossed south of EVRICOURT.
From the OISE to the AISNE the French continue to press the enemy and have made some progress. The line in this part now runs as follows:- PONT L'EVEQUE, canal north of OISE from PONT L'EVEQUE, VARESNES, along the OISE to BRETIGNY and QUIERZY, LE PONCEAU, wood cast of LA TINETTE, LA QUINCEY BASSE, L'AVAL0IRE, west of GUNY, south-west of PONT ST. MARD, BAGNEUX, VILLERS-LA-FOSSE, VAUREZIS, POMMIERS.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
23rd August 1918.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
